article.headline: Ohio 67, Buffalo 51
article.story: ATHENS, Ohio (AP) -- Jerome Tillman and Whitney Davis each scored 15 points and three other Ohio players reached double-digits as the Bobcats defeated Buffalo 67-51 on Thursday night. Leon Williams had 13 points and 12 rebounds, Sonny Troutman had 10 points and Bubba Walther scored 14, including five points in a 13-5 run that gave the Bobcats a 49-40 lead with 7:53 remaining. Ohio (12-5, 3-1 Mid-American Conference) never trailed again. Yassin Idbihi led Buffalo (9-8, 1-3) with 11 points and Andy Robinson had 10. Greg Gamble had eight rebounds. The score was tied at 24 at halftime, but Ohio pulled away in the second half on 52 percent shooting (13-of-25), compared with 36 percent (9-of-25) from Buffalo. The Bulls, who have never won in Athens, outrebounded the Bobcats 34-32. Ohio scored 23 points off 22 Buffalo turnovers.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
